title: Blue Hole
description: The most famous dive site in Dahab. A submarine sinkhole with crystal clear water and stunning blue colors. Known for its deep walls and unique geological formations.

title: The Canyon
description: A deep fissure in the reef table, famous for its light effects and glassfish. One of the most photographed dive sites in the Red Sea with incredible underwater landscapes.

title: Lighthouse
description: Perfect for training and night dives. Features a seagrass area and coral wall. Great for beginners and offers consistent marine life encounters.

title: Three Reefs
description: A series of three reefs separated by sandy patches. Excellent for snorkeling and beginner diving with abundant marine life and coral formations.

title: The Temple
description: Named for its temple-like coral formations. Features dramatic drop-offs and is known for encounters with larger marine life including sharks and rays.

title: Challenger Reef
description: A deep reef with spectacular coral gardens and dramatic walls. Known for its excellent visibility and diverse marine ecosystem including pelagic species.
